result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon F. Dio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying a Concealed Knife [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.231.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*If probation revoked, 114 days of jail credit
Consecutive to: *Consecutive to the sentence he is currently serving

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs and surcharges.
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations at the discretion of the probation agent, if the agent deems it to be necessary.
*Prohibited from having, possessing or using any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only as the prescription requires.
*Provide a DNA sample or proof that one has previously been provided.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shannon F. Dio

records.addlTxt:
Count 1:  Dismissed and Read In 
Count 2:  Withheld Sentence and Placed on Probation
filed by Atty Gary Kryshak

8:37 AM Defendant Shannon F. Dio appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Shannon F. Dio.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Both files heard: 22CF68, 22CF157

Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant states his reason for wanting to appear by zoom. 
Defendant understands that if there are hearing problems to let the court know.
If at any time the defendant needs to speak privately with his/her attorney, the court will make accommodations for that.
Defendant indicates he/she understands the right to be present in the courtroom and has discussed with his/her attorney.
BY THE COURT: Court finds the defendant is his right to be present in person knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily. 

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.  22CF68 Count 2 would be amended to include as a repeater statute.  States the conviction that qualifies him for that.  
Court questions Atty Pfeil regarding the repeater statute. 
Atty Kryshak stipulates to the repeater statute being added. 
Attorney for defendant concurs with the agreement stated.

Court questions the date the defendant signed the plea questionnaire.  
Atty Kryshak responds. 
Court questions the reason for the outright dismissal of 22CF157.
Atty Pfeil responds and also states reason for dismissal of 22CF68 Count 1. 
Court questions Atty Pfeil regarding the 2 years probation length. 
Both parties agree that 2 years is appropriate. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present but had submitted a written statement.
Court questions defendant. 
Defendant agrees with the statements made by counsel. 
BY THE COURT:  Motion to dismiss 22CF157 outright is granted for the reasons stated on the record.  Court relies on the statements made in 22CF157 for the repeater statutes. 
Court questions if the state will be filing an amended information to complete the record. 
Atty Pfeil indicates he will file that. 
Atty Kryshak makes statements regarding the maximum penalty. 
Atty Pfeil agrees with the correction stated being 2 years rather than 4 years. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 22CF68 Count 2 - GUILTY

Court questions Atty Kryshak with regards to the ple questionnaire indicating a no contest plea. 
Atty Kryshak responds.  They are not contesting so the guilty plea can remain.
Court accepts the guilty plea. 

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of 22CF68 Count 2.

Court questions the defendant regarding prior conviction. 
Defendant agrees he was convicted but unsure of the date. 
Court accepts the stipulation and also finds this charge will be as a repeater. 
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction(s) this date.
22CF68 Count 1 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Pfeil makes sentencing arguments to the court.  
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Defendant does not make statements. 

BY THE COURT: 
22CF68 Count 2 - 
Sentence withheld. 
114 days jail credit. 
Placed on Probation for a period of 1 year, consecutive to the sentence he is currently serving. 
Conditions:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations at the discretion of the probation agent if the agent deems it to be necessary.
Prohibited from having, possessing or using any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only as the prescription requires. 
Provide a DNA sample or proof that one has previously been provided. 
Pay costs and surcharges.
Matter set for a P/S on 08/22/2022 at 8:30 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
/s/LJM 6-22-2022 - Approved - Judge Baker.
/s/ 6/22/2022 LJM - Approved.
records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on June 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Matter set for a PTC on 06/06/2022 at 10:00 a.m.  - per request of both parties, moving out PTC so that the 2 cases will track together.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:23 PM Prosecuting attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shannon F. Dio appeared by video, in custody from the Waupaca County jail.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Shannon F. Dio. 

Court questions the defendant is he can hear the court. 
Defendant confirms he can. 

Officer D. Daneault is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Dodge. 
Atty Kryshak stipulates that the defendant is a felon. 
Cross exam by Atty Kryshak. 

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Woman identifies herself as Harley by phone and states she is a witness and would like to testify. 
Atty Kryshak informs her she is not testifying today.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:26 PM Defendant Shannon F. Dio appeared by video, in custody at the Waupaca County Jail.   Attorney Gary J. Kryshak appeared in court for Shannon F. Dio, Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Atty Gary Kryshak appointed
Initial Appearance set for March 7, 2022 @ 1:30 p.m. in Br 1
Do not possess any dangerous weapons.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly Cassidy and Andrew Mutchler appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner appears in court for defendant. 
ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Felon Possess Firearm and Carry Concealed Knife. 
Defendant to call the Public Defender.
Atty Bergner does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
State requests a bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner does not have any objections as to bond. 
BY THE COURT: Court sets bond.
